item.title: Opposition takes shots at Aglukkaq over lack of action on drug shortage
item.description:
Pressure continues to mount on federal Health Minister Leona Aglukkaq to take stronger action to solve the burgeoning medication shortage in Canada.
Drug shortfalls have been occurring more frequently in the last two to three years, both in Canada and around the world. But recent production cuts...

item.title: Santorum wins two southern primaries, humiliating Gingrich and Romney
item.description:
WASHINGTON - Republican presidential hopeful Rick Santorum scored a major victory in America's Deep South on Tuesday, winning two primaries in Alabama and Mississippi in a potentially dramatic shakeup of the party's wildly unpredictable presidential race.
Santorum's triumph in Alabama denied

item.title: NHL general managers eye hybrid icing
item.description:
BOCA RATON, Fla. — After years of hockey people railing about the dangers of touch icing the NHL appears ready to make a rule change and adopt a safer version of the rule.
The league's GMs have decided to take a more detailed look at hybrid icing with the intention of having the

item.title: Man releases final text chat with girlfriend, warns against texting and driving
item.description:
MONTREAL - A series of heartwrenching text messages is being used by the boyfriend of a car accident victim to warn people to pay attention when driving.
Mathieu Fortin has created a Facebook page to get the word out in memory of Emy Brochu, who died Jan. 18 when her car slammed into the back of

item.title: Martin apologizes for robocalls remarks
item.description:
OTTAWA — Manitoba NDP MP Pat Martin has issued a written apology to a Conservative voter-outreach company.
The apology appeared on Martin’s website Tuesday, about six days after he made comments on national TV about Responsive Marketing Group in connection with the robocalls

item.title: Quebec: We'll work to soften the new federal crime bill
item.description:
MONTREAL - Quebec's vigorous opposition of the Harper government's freshly adopted crime legislation entered a new phase Tuesday as the province pledged to minimize the bill's impact on its soil.
The Quebec government, already angered by the legislation's potential cost to the provinces,

item.title: Peterson found guilty of manslaughter
item.description:
A jury has found Daniel Peterson guilty of manslaughter.
Peterson was found not guilty of the more serious charge of second-degree murder for the October 2008 killing of James Cruickshank, who was beaten with a ball-peen hammer.
Peterson admitted to the killing but claimed Cruickshank forced a

item.title: Crown grills Stobbe on relationship with slain wife
item.description:
Accused killer Mark Stobbe will return to the witness box Wednesday morning for a fifth straight day of testimony — the last four of which have been spent under cross-examination from prosecutor Wendy Dawson.
On Tuesday, the Crown grilled him about the details surrouning the October 2000

item.title: Football Bisons add players
item.description:
Head coach Brian Dobie and the University of Manitoba Bisons football team announced the commitment of six Manitoba high school players for the 2012 season.
Joining the Bisons are offensive/defensive lineman Michael Bell of the Oak Park Raiders, defensive back Connor Lesperance and defensive

item.title: Alex Radulov's return to Predators causes stir among NHL general managers
item.description:
BOCA RATON, Fla. - Alex Radulov's potential return to the NHL is causing almost as much controversy as his departure.
With NHL general managers gathered for their annual March meetings, virtually all of the buzz Tuesday surrounded the league's decision to allow the 25-year-old Russian forward to
